001package imagingbook.lib.util.bits;
002
003import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
004import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
005
006/**
007 * This class implements a true 2D bitmap container, i.e., each 0/1 element
008 * occupies only a single bit (unlike {@code boolean} arrays, which require at 
009 * least 8 bits per element).
010 * 
011 * @author WB
012 * @version 2021/01/30
013 */
014public class BitMap {
015        
016        /** the width of this bitmap */
017        private final int width;
018        /** the height of this bitmap */
019        private final int height;
020        
021        private final BitVector bitvec;
022        
023        /**
024         * Constructor.
025         * @param width the width of the new bitmap
026         * @param height the height of the new bitmap
027         */
028        public BitMap(int width, int height) {
029                this(width, height, null);
030        }
031        
032        /**
033         * Constructor.
034         * @param width width the width of the new bitmap
035         * @param height height the height of the new bitmap
036         * @param bytes a byte array, 0 maps to false, anything else to true
037         */
038        public BitMap(int width, int height, byte[] bytes) {
039                this.width = width;
040                this.height = height;
041                this.bitvec = (bytes != null) ? BitVector.from(bytes) : BitVector.create(width * height);
042        }
043        
044        
045        public int getWidth() {
046                return this.width;
047        }
048        
049        public int getHeight() {
050                return this.height;
051        }
052        
053        /**
054         * Returns {@code true} is the specified element is set (1),
055         * {@code false} otherwise (0).
056         * @param x the x-coordinate
057         * @param y the y-coordinate
058         * @return as described
059         */
060        public boolean get(int x, int y) {
061                return bitvec.get(y * width + x);
062        }
063        
064        public boolean get(PntInt p) {
065                return bitvec.get(p.y * width + p.x);
066        }
067        
068        /**
069         * Sets the specified bit-element to the given boolean value
070         * (1 for {@code true}, 0 for {@code false}).
071         * @param x the x-coordinate
072         * @param y the y-coordinate
073         * @param val a boolean value
074         */
075        public void set(int x, int y, boolean val) {
076                if (val) {
077                        this.set(x, y);
078                }
079                else {
080                        this.unset(x, y);
081                }
082        }
083        
084        public void set(PntInt p, boolean val) {
085                set(p.x, p.y, val);
086        }
087        
088        /**
089         * Sets the specified element (to bit-value 1).
090         * @param x the x-coordinate
091         * @param y the y-coordinate
092         */
093        public void set(int x, int y) {
094                bitvec.set(y * width + x);
095        }
096        
097        public void set(PntInt p) {
098                bitvec.set(p.y * width + p.x);
099        }
100        
101        /**
102         * Unsets the specified element (to bit-value 0).
103         * @param x the x-coordinate
104         * @param y the y-coordinate
105         */
106        public void unset(int x, int y) {
107                bitvec.unset(y * width + x);
108        }
109        
110        public void unset(PntInt p) {
111                bitvec.unset(p.y * width + p.x);
112        }
113        
114        /**
115         * Sets all element values to 1.
116         */
117        public void setAll() {
118                bitvec.setAll();
119        }
120        
121        /**
122         * Sets all element values to 0.
123         */
124        public void unsetAll() {
125                bitvec.unsetAll();
126        }
127        
128        /**
129         * Returns the underlying 1D {@link BitVector}.
130         * @return the bitvector
131         */
132        public BitVector getBitVector() {
133                return this.bitvec;
134        }
135        
136        // static methods --------------------------------------------------
137        
138        /**
139         * Creates a new 2D bitmap of the specified size.
140         * @param width the width of the new bitmap
141         * @param height the height of the new bitmap
142         * @return a new bitmap
143         */
144        public static BitMap create(int width, int height) {
145                return new BitMap(width, height);
146        }
147        
148}
